resources.string: "Solving the cube involves following a set of moves." "To illustrate the moves we will use cube notations as listed below.\n" "Each of these moves is a 90 degree turn of the relevant pieces." "Each move also has a corresponding opposite move which is denoted with an apostrophe ( ' )." "In addition, a 180 degree turn of a face denoted with '2'. " "For example, a 180 degree turn of a the up face is denoted as 'U2'."

"The Beginner algorithm
" "The Beginner or Layer by Layer algorithm (LBL) divides the cube into layers and you solve each layer by using specific algorithms.
" "Compared to other methods there are only a few algorithms to memorize, and they are relatively intuitive.
" "This technique is perfect for beginners since it is the most accessible." "On the other hand, this method is not efficient for speedcubing. " "An average LBL solve is around 130 moves. " "If you want to achieve speeds under one minute, it is recommended to learn additional methods.
" "You can read more information about the method in this" link

"The CFOP algorithm
" "The most popular Speedsolving method is the CFOP (Cross, First 2 layers, Orientation of last layer, Permutation of last layer) ," "also known as the Fridrich method. " "Unlike The beginner's method, the Speedsolving method focuses mainly about solving the Rubik's cube in the fastest " "and most efficient way, rather than the easiest way.
" "The CFOP method average number of moves for a complete solution is ~56 moves." "This method is similar to the Beginner algorithm, however, it combines some of the steps, solving more of the cube at once.
" "The method works on a layer-by-layer system, first solving a cross typically on the bottom, " "continuing to solve the first two layers (F2L), orienting the last layer (OLL), " "and finally permuting the last layer (PLL).
" "You can read more information about the method in this" link

"The Koecimba algorithm
" "Also called the Two-Phase Algorithm. Like its name, the algorithm solves the Cube in two phases " "and can solve it in 29 moves or less.
" "In the first phase, the algorithm looks for maneuvers which will transform a scrambled cube to G1 group. " "This group is a subset of all possible cubes that we get if we turn the faces of a solved cube " "and don't use the moves that turn the right, left, front and back faces 90 degrees " "(but can move these faces 180 degrees). " "In this subset, pieces in the middle layer will stay in the middle layer without flipping, " "and pieces in the top and bottom layers can only exchange between those layers without twisting or flipping.
" "In the second phase the algorithm restores the cube in the subgroup G1, using only moves of this subgroup. " "It restores the permutation of the 8 corners, the permutation of the 8 edges of the Up-face and Down-face " "and the permutation of the 4 UD-slice edges (the edges between the Up-face and Down-face).
" "The algorithm doesn't stop when a first solution is found but continues to search for shorter solutions " "by carrying out phase 2 from suboptimal solutions of phase 1.
" "You can read more information about the method in this" link
